question: What is Eduvance.au?
answer: Previously AP-Edexcel, Eduvance.au is a platform where students studying IGCSEs and IALs can connect, collaborate, and share resources. As the largest Edexcel-centric community on Discord, Eduvance.au is committed to helping students advance in their education through community support and shared academic tools.

question: Who is Eduvance for?
answer: Eduvance is for learners across IGCSE and IALs (AS + A2).

question: How will I benefit from Eduvance?
answer: Eduvance.au is committed to helping students advance in their education through community support and shared academic tools. From revision and learning resources to solving your doubts, we're here to make education easier, smarter, and more connected.

question: Which IAL subjects can I receive help with in Eduvance?
answer: Accounting, Biology, Business, Chemistry, Economics, English Language, English Literature, Further Mathematics, Information Technology, Mathematics, Physics, Psychology.

question: How can I contact Eduvance for support?
answer: You can contact Eduvance through their official website or through the Discord server for support and enquiries.

question: Can I apply for community positions?
answer: Of course! We're thrilled to invite passionate and dedicated members of our community to apply for community roles on our rapidly growing community! Whether you're interested in shaping resources, maintaining standards, building tools, or leading the community - there's a place for you on the team!

question: How can I apply for staff roles?
answer: Please check the #staff-application channel in our Discord server for latest info regarding that!

question: Can I get career advice in Eduvance?
answer: Of course, you can! We have designated channels for career advice and discussion in our Discord server.

question: What language is used for communication in Eduvance?
answer: English-only rule applies (GIFs and images included). Communicate in English to promote a cohesive and inclusive atmosphere, exceptions: language specific channels and greetings (For example: Assalamualaikum).

question: When do Grade Boundaries release for a particular session?
answer: It is released 1 or 2 hours before the online results release time.

question: What is the difference between UMS and Raw Marks?
answer: Raw Marks are your actual marks in an exam. For example, if the exam is out of 75 and you got 51/75 then 51/75 is your raw marks. UMS stands for Uniform Mark Scale and itâ€™s the mark examiners use by multiplying your raw mark by a factor that differs every session to determine your grade for a specific unit.

question: What Time do online Results Release for both IAL & IGCSE?
answer: It releases at 9:00 am UK Standard Time (GMT+1).

question: What calculator can I use while doing Edexcel exams?
What is the work of a Resource Creator in Eduvance?
answer: As a Resource Creator, you will be responsible for developing custom Eduvance notes and materials. You'll work closely with the staff team, contributing to the advancement and future success of Eduvance resources!

question: Can I become a mod?
answer: When the time is right, we will open moderator applications in staff-application. At that point, you will be able to apply through the provided form, which will be carefully reviewed by the staff team. If selected, you will begin with a trial phase, which may then lead to a permanent moderator position.

question: Can I share my notes with others?
answer: Sure! Please open a ticket in share-notes channel in Discord if you wish to share any materials.
